alert.note: Alert for Cooke (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:08PM CDT until June 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN COOKE AND GRAYSON COUNTIES... At 408 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Whitesboro, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 65 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Sherman, Whitesboro, Denison, Van Alstyne, Howe, Pottsboro, Collinsville, Whitewright, Gunter, Bells, Tom Bean, Knollwood, Dorchester, Randell Lake, Lake Kiowa, Eisenhower State Park, Valley Lake, Lake Texoma, Preston and Southmayd. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...65 MPH
info.instruction: Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately.
